summary: the tiniest Caleb meta
title: the tiniest Caleb meta
body:
(episode 62 spoilers under the cut)

I wanna say a lil something about how the convo about the Astrid letter between Caleb, Jester, and Nott because while yes, it’s quite worrying that Caleb’s backstory is DEFINITELY trundling towards the gang like an angry freight train this was also a pretty great snapshot of how Caleb has changed over time, particularly in his attitudes towards the group. It’s fairly easy to imagine if this conversation, or a conversation like this one, had happened earlier in the campaign that Caleb would have gotten angry with Nott and Jester, probably would have stormed off before finishing the exchange, and maybe made some cryptic remarks about people looking for him while refusing to give anything away. 

Now we have Caleb fairly even-handedly trying to figure out exactly what was said in the letter, showing concern not for himself but for Jester’s mother, and moreover taking on some of the blame for the situation himself. He’s trusted and liked the Mighty Nein for some time now, and even been worried about his past’s potential to hurt the others, but I think this is the first instance where he’s dealt with his past so calmly. That soon after he carefully confronted Fjord trying to get him to open up puts a pretty nice bow on the whole thing.

Oh and Nott saying that she wanted Caleb to have a friend, and Caleb saying that he does have friends? Excuse while I go stand in a corner and stare at a wall emotionally for about twenty minutes until I can DEAL

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.

summary: CR
body:
CR

Rewatching the scene where Nott and Jester write the letter to Astrid and watching Liam’s face journey during that is quite something. His mild amusement at the beginning which then goes to like just done and back to amusement at the end. With so much in between.

BTW that letter included “Mrs. Lavorre Esquire” and something like “the legal practice of Nott and Brave Legal Firm” and was scented with perfume. And honestly I’m not sure anyone will know what to make of it. Is it a scam? Is it some kind of code? What the fuck is this?

reblog.comment:

summary: So I don’t know much about scrying - but could Fjord’s need to randomly roll wisdom on the last two games have more to do with...
body:
So I don’t know much about scrying - but could Fjord’s need to randomly roll wisdom on the last two games have more to do with someone scrying on him and less to do with Uk’otoa?


Also could the ‘spice’ and ‘whitestone’ in the crates that Nott and Beau found be part of the ingredients for the rift anchors? They never did find what the liquid in the central orb was made up of.

reblog.comment:
So I don’t know much about scrying - but could Fjord’s need to randomly roll wisdom on the last two games have more to do with someone scrying on him and less to do with Uk’otoa?


Also could the ‘spice’ and ‘whitestone’ in the crates that Nott and Beau found be part of the ingredients for the rift anchors? They never did find what the liquid in the central orb was made up of.

trail.content_raw:
So I don’t know much about scrying - but could Fjord’s need to randomly roll wisdom on the last two games have more to do with someone scrying on him and less to do with Uk’otoa?


Also could the ‘spice’ and ‘whitestone’ in the crates that Nott and Beau found be part of the ingredients for the rift anchors? They never did find what the liquid in the central orb was made up of.
trail.content:
So I don’t know much about scrying - but could Fjord’s need to randomly roll wisdom on the last two games have more to do with someone scrying on him and less to do with Uk’otoa?


Also could the ‘spice’ and ‘whitestone’ in the crates that Nott and Beau found be part of the ingredients for the rift anchors? They never did find what the liquid in the central orb was made up of.

tags: im just having big feelings about my disaster kids today
this is by no means exhaustive
just what's on my mind right now
summary: M9 and the roles they play in the group
body:
M9 and the roles they play in the group

Beau: Calls people on their shit; validates their trauma; strategist–especially in all things criminal; tries to point the group in the direction of “leaving places better than the found them”; perhaps the closest thing they have to a moral compass

Caduceus: Tries to set people at ease when they’re unsure or panicking; The Cook; makes sure they don’t fucking die; encourages people to follow their destinies; gently judgmental when needed

Caleb: Encourages them to think about the group picture; determinator; frequently the one to make drastic choices to try to save them when they’re backed into a corner; “no but really we need to talk about this”

Fjord: Voice of reason (when he’s not pushing the big red button); believes in The Group as an ideal; will protect The Group both as an ideal and materially; frequently the party diplomat/negotiator

Jester: Works hard to make everyone laugh, or just a little bit happier; validates people’s insecurities; aggressively supportive, and giver of great-but-silly advice; encourages the group to think about how their actions impact individuals; everyone else’s litmus test for trusting someone (if you don’t like Jester you are probably a Bad Person)

Nott: Mom Friend–do you have your lunch money? how’s your AC looking? why don’t you go talk to that nice boy?; strategist, especially in all things explosive; Will Absolutely Take A Bullet For You; supports everyone without question or reservation in pursuing their goals (she just wants everyone to be their best self)

Yasha: The friend you sit in the corner of a crowded party with; quiet comfort and gentle humor; “Would you like me to kill them for you?”; protects them in battle; conspiracy theory generator

Jester: Works hard to make everyone laugh, or just a little bit happier; validates people’s insecurities; aggressively supportive, and giver of great-but-silly advice; encourages the group to think about how their actions impact individuals; everyone else’s litmus test for trusting someone (if you don’t like Jester you are probably a Bad Person)

Yasha: The friend you sit in the corner of a crowded party with; quiet comfort and gentle humor; “Would you like me to kill them for you?”; protects them in battle; conspiracy theory generator
